tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: HTTP Basic access authentication to retrive Access Token for further access

externalDocs.description: Visit WEB to check Standard List Price

access_token.description: Access Token for further HTTP header

post.description: Request a quote for a ride. This endpoint provides estimated pricing based on the given parameters like location, destination, and ride type.
Send a request and create a new Booking

get.summary: Return All Bookings with Date Range
get.description: Returns All active Booking base on query dates

get.summary: Return a single Booking Detail from Booking ID

post.description: Send a request to Cancel a Booking

get.description: Returns a map of status codes to quantities

access_token.description: Access Token for further HTTP header

x_gojo_request_signature.name: api_key
x_gojo_request_signature.description: HMAC hash combining your shared secret and the request payload. Utilize this hash to authenticate and validate incoming requests from Good Journey. This ensures the security and integrity of the data received.

requestBody.description: This webhook event, assignedDriver, is triggered when a driver is assigned to a booking. It sends detailed information about the driver and the assignment. Use this event to update booking status in your system and to inform customers about their driver details.

200.description: Return a 200 status to indicate that the data was received successfully

requestBody.description: The bookingStatus webhook event is triggered when there is a change in the status of a booking. It provides comprehensive updates for each stage of the booking process, such as when the booking is accepted, a driver is assigned, the driver is en route, the passenger is on board, and up to the point of drop-off or cancellation. This event allows for real-time tracking and management of bookings.

200.description: Return a 200 status to indicate that the data was received successfully

requestBody.description: The driverLocation webhook event is triggered whenever there is an update to a driver's location. This event is crucial for real-time tracking of drivers, enabling efficient management of ride progress and enhancing customer service by providing live location updates of the assigned driver.

200.description: Return a 200 status to indicate that the data was received successfully
